newsitem.title: JAPAN: Teijin, two others take over U.S. resin venture.
newsitem.headline: Teijin, two others take over U.S. resin venture.

text.p: Teijin Ltd said on Tuesday that it, Nichimen Corp and Maruzen Petrochemical Co Ltd had acquired a controlling stake in a U.S. venture that makes a synthetic resin called metton.

The three companies boosted the capital of T&N Chemical Inc, an investment firm owned by the companies, to $5 million from $1 million and then increased the investment firm's share in the venture, Metton America Inc, to 60 percent from 35 percent, a Teijin spokesman said.
Metton America's president and Nichimen's U.S. subsidiary hold stakes of 35 percent and five percent respectively in Metton, Teijin said in a statement.
The investment firm increased its share in the venture by purchasing shares from U.S. firm 21st Century Containers Ltd.
The move is aimed at expanding the venture's business in the United States, Teijin said in a statement.
Metton, developed originally by Hercules Inc of the United States, is used in such areas as construction machinery and trucks, the statement said.
